metadata.title: CVE-2022-32222 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A cryptographic vulnerability exists on Node.js on linux in versions of18.x prior to 18.40.0 which allowed a default path for openssl.cnf thatmight be accessible under some circumstances to a non-admin user instead of/etc/ssl as was the case in versions prior to the upgrade to OpenSSL 3.

criterions.comment: nodejs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
